copy.description: Copies a dashboard into a specified folder.

rename.name: rename
rename.description: Allows to rename the content that will be copied.

edit.description: Edit queries of Looks and Dashboard tiles.

rename.name: rename
rename.description: Allows to rename the content that will be copied.

bulk.name: bulk
bulk.description: Allows to edit dashboard tiles in bulk.

get_properties.name: get_properties
get_properties.description: Display the properties of the content you want to edit, before editing it.

edit_dashboard_properties.name: edit_dashboard_properties
edit_dashboard_properties.description: Allows to edit the properties of the dashboard before editing the dashboard elements. (Ex : Edit filters)

ls.description:
Lists the content of the selected folder and its subfolders.
  Use the options to save the output to a png image, display the looks and dashboards and set the depth in the folder binocle must search in. Click on the contents and folders ids in your terminal (provided it supports it, use iTerm2 for instance) to open them in your default browser.
examples:
$ binocle ls 123 -d 2
üìÅ Folder A #123 (D:0 - L:0)
|   üìÅ Folder B #145 (D:0 - L:2)
|   |   üìÅ Folder D #547 (D:0 - L:3)
|   üìÅ Folder C #156 (D:1 - L:7)

image.name: image
image.description: Creates an image of the listing in the current directory

depth.name: depth
depth.description: Sets the subfolders depth to display. Unlimited depth : -1

show_content.name: show_content
show_content.description: Displays Looks and Dashboards in the listing

pause.description: Gets all schedules of a Look/Dashboard and enables pausing/unpausing them. NB: if any runs were skipped while it was paused, it will run once after being unpaused.

revert.name: revert
revert.description: Revert: displays paused schedules and enabling unpausing them

args.name: user_id
args.description: If no user_id is provided defaults to the API3 Key owner

restore.description: Check if a look or dashboard has been deleted by id and restore it if possible in a chosen folder.
